title: What were the career goals for paper boys in 1975 | ABC NEWS
description: In 1975, the ABC asked young Aussie paper boys what they wanted to be when they grew up.   Social video by Megan Jacobson for the ABC News Social Media Team using footage from the ABC Archives. title: Russia pounds Ukraine with drones and missiles, hitting energy sites ahead of winter | ABC NEWS
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has condemned a wave of Russian drone and missile attacks on Kyiv that killed six people. It was one of the biggest attacks on the capital since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine. title: Health star ratings likely to become mandatory as industry misses target | ABC NEWS
description: Health star ratings are likely to become mandatory as the food industry missed its 70 per cent target. Health star ratings are only on 37 per cent of products according to new figures. Experts say food companies are using them as a marketing tactic and mostly putting them on healthy foods. title: How long until humanoid robots become useful? | ABC NEWS
description: The race to develop AI-powered, human-like robots is accelerating. Adam Dorr, a futurist at think tank RethinkX, says that these robots clunky stages, reminiscent of the early internet and iPhone.  Dorr believes it typically takes about 15 years for a market to mature, suggesting we should prepare for a future in which technology can perform tasks as well as humans. title: Court finds BHP liable over deadly Brazilian dam collapse | ABC NEWS
description: BHP has been found liable by a British court for its role in a 2015 dam collapse at a Brazilian mine that killed 19 people.  The court ruled that the disaster, which released toxic mud downstream and harmed local communities, "could have been avoided."  BHP plans to appeal the decision. title: Pregnant mother dies in crash, 19yo charged | ABC NEWS
description: A pregnant woman, 33, and her unborn baby died after being hit by a car in Hornsby on Friday night.  A 19-year-old provisional driver was arrested in Wahroonga on Saturday morning and charged. He has been refused bail and will appear in Parramatta Local Court on Sunday. title: Trump signs order to drop tariffs on hundreds of foods, including beef | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order exempting hundreds of food products from tariffs in response to high grocery prices.   Beef, one of Australia's top exports, was included in the list, alongside cocoa, oranges and tomatoes. title: Zelenskyy condemns Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv | ABC NEWS
description: Russia launched a heavy drone and missile attack on Ukraine overnight on Friday local time, killing eight people and wounding dozens, Ukrainian officials said.  Kyiv residents told of harrowing escapes and near misses in the dead of night.  In response, Volodomyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine launched its own drone and missile attack on Russian targets.
